kpis.description: This KPI measures the cash generated from the normal operating activities of a business, indicating the efficiency of the company's core business operations.
kpis.formula: Total Operating Cash Flow = Net Income + Depreciation and Amortization + Changes in Working Capital

kpis.description: This KPI represents the cash a company generates after accounting for capital expenditures, indicating the cash available for distribution among all security holders of the organization.
kpis.formula: Total Free Cash Flow = Operating Cash Flow - Capital Expenditures

kpis.description: This KPI measures a company's ability to cover its total debt with its cash and cash equivalents, providing insight into financial stability and liquidity.
kpis.formula: Cash to Debt Ratio = Cash and Cash Equivalents / Total Debt

kpis.kpi: Avg Number of Days to Collect Payment After a Sale
kpis.description: This KPI indicates the average number of days it takes for a company to collect payment after a sale has been made, reflecting the efficiency of the accounts receivable process.
kpis.formula: Avg Days to Collect Payment = (Accounts Receivable / Total Credit Sales) * 365

kpis.description: This KPI measures a company's ability to pay off its current liabilities with its cash and cash equivalents, providing a conservative view of liquidity.
kpis.formula: Cash Ratio = Cash and Cash Equivalents / Current Liabilities
